Query: With appropriate complementary factors, mutant is expressed in all tissues competent to form anthocyanins.
Matches: At 6 to 7 DAG, the double mutants uniformly start to form the first pair of true leaves and eventually develop into impaired small plantlets, with dark red cotyledons and asymmetrical leaves.

Query: With appropriate complementary factors, mutant is expressed in all tissues competent to form anthocyanins.
Matches: In the case of CSN3, the complete loss of function of CSN5 results in the accumulation of a larger and possibly modified CSN3 form, whereas the normal (smaller) CSN3 form is present predominantly in wild type.

Matches: None of the double mutants arrest at the seedling stage, and even though severely compromised, mutant plantlets survive to a mature stage.

Matches: During the first two to three DAG, the double homozygous mutant progeny display the typical photomorphogenic phenotype of the fusca mutants.

Matches: Dark-grown mutant seedlings are transferred to the light, a significant portion of the seedlings are unable to green and will bleach out and die.

Query: Anthocyanin color with A1 A2 C1 C2 R1 -PLUS- Pr1 Bz1 and Bz2.
Matches: Mutant belonging to the strong class.

Query: Anthocyanin color with A1 A2 C1 C2 R1 -PLUS- Pr1 Bz1 and Bz2.
Matches: Milder phenotypes than that observed in the mutants of the lethal class.

Query: Anthocyanin color with A1 A2 C1 C2 R1 -PLUS- Pr1 Bz1 and Bz2.
Matches: Not adult lethal although mutation causes a severe size reduction of light-grown mature plants and greatly reduce seed set.

Query: Anthocyanin color with A1 A2 C1 C2 R1 -PLUS- Pr1 Bz1 and Bz2.
Matches: Dark-grown seedlings homozygous for the mutation exhibit light-grown characteristics, including patterns of cell differentiation and gene expression.

Query: Anthocyanin color with A1 A2 C1 C2 R1 -PLUS- Pr1 Bz1 and Bz2.
Matches: The mutant does not show additional hypocotyl elongation under far-red light-enriched conditions, whereas the wild-type seedlings display more than a twofold increase in hypocotyl elongation.

Query: Anthocyanin color with A1 A2 C1 C2 R1 -PLUS- Pr1 Bz1 and Bz2.
Matches: Under long-day or continuous light conditions, wild-type plants and the mutant flower after producing approximately seven rosette leaves and growing for 3 to 4 weeks.

Query: Anthocyanin color with A1 A2 C1 C2 R1 -PLUS- Pr1 Bz1 and Bz2.
Matches: However, under short-day conditions, wildtype plants produce more than 40 rosette leaves and grow for ~75 days before flowering, whereas the mutant line continues to produce only seven rosette leaves and flower earlier than the wild-type plants.

Query: Anthocyanin color with A1 A2 C1 C2 R1 -PLUS- Pr1 Bz1 and Bz2.
Matches: Indistinguishable from the respective cop1 mutants when grown in darkness.

Query: Anthocyanin color with A1 A2 C1 C2 R1 -PLUS- Pr1 Bz1 and Bz2.
Matches: No suppression of the light-dependent cop1 phenotype where seedlings bleach and die when transferred from darkness to light.

Query: Anthocyanin color with A1 A2 C1 C2 R1 -PLUS- Pr1 Bz1 and Bz2.
Matches: This is in contrast to the phenotype observed in the other two double mutants: cop1-4/hyh and cop1-6/hyh.

Query: Anthocyanin color with A1 A2 C1 C2 R1 -PLUS- Pr1 Bz1 and Bz2.
Matches: Dark-grown seedlings homozygous for weak copl mutations have longer hypocotyls than their light-grown siblings and light-grown wild-type seedlings, although they are clearly shorter than etiolated wild-type seedlings.

Query: Anthocyanin color with A1 A2 C1 C2 R1 -PLUS- Pr1 Bz1 and Bz2.
Matches: Mutant belonging to the weak class.

Query: Anthocyanin color with A1 A2 C1 C2 R1 -PLUS- Pr1 Bz1 and Bz2.
Matches: Milder phenotypes than that observed in the mutants of the strong class.

Query: Anthocyanin color with A1 A2 C1 C2 R1 -PLUS- Pr1 Bz1 and Bz2.
Matches: Suppression in a substantial number of seedlings of the light-dependent cop1 phenotype where seedlings bleach and die when transferred from darkness to light.

Query: Anthocyanin color with A1 A2 C1 C2 R1 -PLUS- Pr1 Bz1 and Bz2.
Matches: Roots of the mutant contained ~20-fold the amount of chlorophyll of the wild type.
